name: Alexandre Sepulveda De Dietrich
headline: Data Scientist and Business Analytics MS candidate
targetRoleLine: Seeking Summer 2026 Data Science / ML Engineer / Analytics internships in NYC
about: I build reliable analytics and machine learning systems that help teams make confident decisions. My focus includes anomaly detection, time series analysis, and data quality work for finance and commercial teams.
heroProofBullets: Built an accounting data quality and anomaly detection pipeline at CHANEL Europe.
Built a camera and ranging sensor fusion pipeline with CentraleSupélec L2S Lab and Forvia.
impactHighlights: Delivered analytics tooling in industry settings.
Built a computer vision and sensor fusion prototype in research-industry collaboration.
Project delivery in industry and research settings.

caseStudies.title: Chanel Europe Analytics Pipeline
caseStudies.subtitle: Data Scientist Intern, Advanced Analytics and Data Science · CHANEL Europe
caseStudies.summary: Accounting data quality and anomaly detection pipeline supporting finance workflows.
context: Built during an internship in CHANEL Europe's Advanced Analytics and Data Science team.
Project served finance stakeholders who needed stronger trust in accounting data.
problem: Accounting data quality issues and anomalies reduced confidence in downstream analysis.
Teams needed practical monitoring outputs that could be reviewed with non-technical partners.
constraints: Mixed data types required robust handling and validation logic.
Domain constraints in finance workflows required explainable outputs for stakeholder review.
approach: Built data quality checks and anomaly detection logic for accounting datasets.
Developed mixed-data detection workflows and tracked experiments.
Collaborated with finance stakeholders to align outputs with deployment needs.
results: Delivered monitoring outputs used by finance stakeholders.
TODO: Add quantitative impact metrics (Available on request).

media.alt: Placeholder visual for CHANEL Europe analytics pipeline case study.
media.caption: TODO: Replace with pipeline diagram or screenshot.

nextImprovements: Add formal model and data drift monitoring dashboards.
Package reusable quality checks for faster rollout across adjacent finance datasets.

caseStudies.title: Forvia Camera Radar Fusion Prototype
caseStudies.subtitle: Research Project · CentraleSupélec L2S Lab and Forvia
caseStudies.summary: Sensor fusion prototype for vehicle tracking using camera and ranging sensor data.
context: Built in a collaboration between CentraleSupélec L2S Lab and Forvia.
Project explored practical multi-sensor tracking behavior in a controlled environment.
problem: Single-sensor signals were insufficiently robust for stable tracking behavior.
Team needed a fusion prototype that aligned and combined camera and ranging data.
constraints: Sensor alignment and synchronization had to remain stable across test conditions.
Prototype scope focused on controlled test-area validation rather than full production deployment.
approach: Built a camera and ranging sensor fusion pipeline.
Validated tracking behavior through controlled test runs and shared findings with partners.
results: Validated tracking accuracy in a controlled test area.
TODO: Add quantitative tracking metrics (Available on request).

media.alt: Placeholder visual for Forvia camera and radar fusion case study.
media.caption: TODO: Replace with tracking output screenshot or GIF.

nextImprovements: Evaluate robustness under additional lighting and motion conditions.
Add confidence scoring and failure-case analysis for each tracking sequence.
